sen.j: 茶釜（ちゃがま）は、茶道に使用する茶道具の一種で、茶に使用する湯を沸かすための釜のことである。
sen.e: Chagama is a type of tea utensils used in Sado, which are used to boil water for tea.

sen.j: 風炉に用いる茶釜はとくに風炉釜（ふろがま）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Chagama used for furo (furnace) is called a furogama tea kettle.

sen.j: 分福茶釜で知られるように茶釜は小さなものは直径30cm程度から、大きなものは100cm程度まであり、主に鉄で作られている。
sen.e: As it is know in Bunbuku chagama (The Magic Teakettle), chagama is made mainly with iron and comes in various sizes from 30cm in diameter to around 100cm in diameter.

sen.e: As it is known in a Japanese folktale called "Bunbuku chagama" (The Magic Teakettle), chagama is made mainly of iron and comes in various sizes from 30cm to around 100cm in diameter.
sen.cmt: Bunbuku chagamaだけでは何のことかわからないので、a Japanese folktaleを補足しました。

sen.j: 日本で古くに開発され、文化圏は日本に留まるが、日本国外でも茶の湯は行なわれており、世界中で使用されている。
sen.e: Chagama was developed in Japan long ago and its cultural region remains in Japan but it is used throughout the world as Chanoyu (the tea ceremony) is also practiced outside Japan.

sen.j: 茶釜はほとんど炉の上に直接据えて用いるが、天井から下げた鎖にかけて用いる小ぶりの茶釜も存在する。
sen.e: Commonly chagama is placed directly onto a hearth, but there is also a small chagama, which are hanged to a chain suspended from ceiling.

sen.j: これを釣り茶釜（つりちゃがま）といい、春先（三月から四月頃）に用いる。
sen.e: This is called a tsuri chagama (hanging chagama, iron tea ceremony pot) and is used in early spring (around March to April).

sen.e: Chagama is an appreciative item like other tea utensils.

sen.e: Commonly guests appreciate from the front when chagama is off the hearth at charcoal temae.
